017package com.github.rwitzel.streamflyer.internal.thirdparty;
018
019import java.util.Collection;
020
021/**
022 * The code of this class is copied from <code>org.apache.commons.lang.Validate</code> 
023 * in order to avoid additional dependencies to other projects.
024 * <p>  
025 * The name is prefixed with <code>Zzz</code> to avoid confusion in case the
026 * original classes are also available in classpath.  
027 */
028
029/**
030 * <p>
031 * This class assists in validating arguments.
032 * </p>
033 * <p>
034 * The class is based along the lines of JUnit. If an argument value is deemed invalid, an IllegalArgumentException is
035 * thrown. For example:
036 * </p>
037 * 
038 * <pre>
039 * Validate.isTrue(i &gt; 0, &quot;The value must be greater than zero: &quot;, i);
040 * Validate.notNull(surname, &quot;The surname must not be null&quot;);
041 * </pre>
042 * 
043 * @author Apache Software Foundation
044 * @author <a href="mailto:ola.berg@arkitema.se">Ola Berg</a>
045 * @author Gary Gregory
046 * @author Norm Deane
047 * @since 2.0
048 * @version $Id: Validate.java 905636 2010-02-02 14:03:32Z niallp $
049 */
050public class ZzzValidate {
051    // Validate has no dependencies on other classes in Commons Lang at present
052
053    /**
054     * Constructor. This class should not normally be instantiated.
055     */
056    public ZzzValidate() {
057        super();
058    }
059
060    // notNull
061    // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
062
063    /**
064     * <p>
065     * Validate that the specified argument is not <code>null</code>; otherwise throwing an exception.
066     * 
067     * <pre>
068     * Validate.notNull(myObject);
069     * </pre>
070     * <p>
071     * The message of the exception is &quot;The validated object is null&quot;.
072     * </p>
073     * 
074     * @param object
075     *            the object to check
076     * @throws IllegalArgumentException
077     *             if the object is <code>null</code>
078     */
079    public static void notNull(Object object) {
080        notNull(object, "The validated object is null");
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * <p>
085     * Validate that the specified argument is not <code>null</code>; otherwise throwing an exception with the specified
086     * message.
087     * 
088     * <pre>
089     * Validate.notNull(myObject, &quot;The object must not be null&quot;);
090     * </pre>
091     * 
092     * @param object
093     *            the object to check
094     * @param message
095     *            the exception message if invalid
096     */
097    public static void notNull(Object object, String message) {
098        if (object == null) {
099            throw new IllegalArgumentException(message);
100        }
101    }
102
103    /**
104     * <p>
105     * Validate that the argument condition is <code>true</code>; otherwise throwing an exception with the specified
106     * message. This method is useful when validating according to an arbitrary boolean expression, such as validating a
107     * primitive number or using your own custom validation expression.
108     * </p>
109     * 
110     * <pre>
111     * Validate.isTrue((i &gt; 0), &quot;The value must be greater than zero&quot;);
112     * Validate.isTrue(myObject.isOk(), &quot;The object is not OK&quot;);
113     * </pre>
114     * 
115     * @param expression
116     *            the boolean expression to check
117     * @param message
118     *            the exception message if invalid
119     * @throws IllegalArgumentException
120     *             if expression is <code>false</code>
121     */
122    public static void isTrue(boolean expression, String message) {
123        if (expression == false) {
124            throw new IllegalArgumentException(message);
125        }
126    }
127
128    /**
129     * Validates that the given collection is not empty.
130     * 
131     * @param collection
132     * @param collectionName
133     */
134    public static void isNotEmpty(Collection<?> collection, String collectionName) {
135        notNull(collection, collectionName + " must not be null");
136        isTrue(!collection.isEmpty(), collectionName + " must not be empty");
137    }
138
139    //
140    // extensions of the third-party code (not part of the third-party code)
141    //
142
143    public static void isZeroOrPositiveNumber(double number, String variableName) {
144        if (number < 0) {
145            throw new IllegalArgumentException(variableName + " must be a zero or a positive number but was " + number);
146        }
147    }
148
149    public static void isGreaterThanZero(double number, String variableName) {
150        if (number <= 0) {
151            throw new IllegalArgumentException(variableName + " must be greather than zero but was " + number);
152        }
153    }
154}
